page.title: 05SHUTTLEWORTHS FARM
page.content: The crops they grow here are mostly grass but there are also some potatoes . There is two hundred acres of grassland and four acres of potatoes. Potatoes are grown for two to three years then grain crops with grass are grown. They keep 150 cattle. Fifty of these are milk cows.100 animals are calves from a few days old to two years old. Some of these are male which are used for beef. Most of the cows are Fresians and a few are Guernseys. They also keep 100 breeding ewes. All the lambs are sold for meat. Forty years ago the farm was about 130 acres but small farms in the district have been added. The farmhouse was not originally part of the holding.A much smaller house now used as the farm dairy and feed store was then the farm house. The old buildings were stone with slate rooves.
